intro: Schizaea elegans var. attenuata, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a species of vascular fern that belongs to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems that bear small, scale-like leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Schizaea elegans var. attenuata produces spore-bearing cones, which are clustered at the tips of its stems. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
